key_channel_insights.line_content: Consistently shows over 97% fares priced higher than direct rates, with up to 5% not found in certain windows.
Over 95% of fares are below direct rates, with minimal higher fare outliers and stable coverage.
More than 98% of fares are higher, reflecting a strong channel premium with slight recent dips in the gap.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Across all categories, over 97% of itineraries are priced higher on OTA versus direct.
Instances of matching or undercutting the direct website are effectively zero.
Up to 5% of itineraries go missing in OTA, especially from Non-PL origins and close-in windows.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Between 0% and 5% of itineraries are not found on OTA, peaking with Non-PL origins and short booking windows.
Near-zero presence across all segments, with only minor exceptions in select long-haul and close-in itineraries.
No material coverage; there is effectively no undercut of the website in the dataset.
Consistent 95%+ share, with premiums ranging up to 0.65% above direct fares.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 98% of quotes are higher in OTA; around 2% missing coverage and no lower alignment.
Roughly 98% remain higher; a slight 2% shift to same-price offers in the latest period.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: OTA higher at nearly 99% and minimal (about 1%) not-found records.
OTA higher jumped from ~95% to 98% week-over-week, with up to 5% not found.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 97% OTA higher, at an average 0.44% premium above direct.
100% of listed fares exceed direct by about 0.65%.

mse_highlights.line_content: Over 95% of itineraries are cheaper on MSE than on the direct site, consistent across short and long haul.
Channel-higher rates stay under 1% for short haul and near 2% for long haul, posing limited risk.
Exact price matches remain rare, hovering around 2–3% on short haul and virtually absent on long haul.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Present in only 0.67% of cases, slightly up from 0.44% last week, indicating minor gaps in coverage.
At 2.7% overall, stability is evident with negligible weekly or monthly swings.
Below 1% overall, reflecting minimal fare overshoots versus the direct site.
Dominates at nearly 96%, solidifying the channel's lower-cost positioning.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 95.76% of fares are lower on MSE, a modest 0.17% gain from last week. MSE-higher offers remain below 1%.
97.73% of results favor MSE-lower, with a 2.27% MSE-higher frequency. MSE N/A or exact matches are negligible.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 96.4% of itineraries are cheaper on MSE, up by 0.44% from last week. MSE-higher remains minimal at 0.26%.
MSE-lower stands at 91.23%, down 5.2% from the previous week. MSE-higher is 3.51%, indicating some volatility.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 95.18% MSE-lower, essentially unchanged week to week. MSE-higher is subdued at 0.64%.
97.76% of fairs favor MSE-lower, slightly down from last week. Channel-higher fares remain under 1%.

gds_highlights.line_content: Over 98% of fares come in higher on GDS, sustaining a clear channel premium with slight downward shifts in difference.
Long-haul routes show nearly a 100% GDS-higher rate but at only 0.03–0.04% above the direct site, lower than short-haul differentials.
Far-out bookings display a higher GDS gap, at around 0.76% last week narrowing to 0.68% by last month.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Under 2% across key segments, with minor fluctuations week to week.
No notable parity; identical pricing is essentially absent in the data.
Dominates at over 98%; the price gap dipped slightly from 0.59% to 0.54% across weeks.
Statistically insignificant or zero share, indicating no consistent undercutting.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 98.76–99.51% GDS-higher, with a modest gap declining from 0.65% last week to 0.59% by last month.
100% GDS-higher, stable at only 0.03–0.04% above direct booking.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Consistently near 99% GDS-higher, with a gap easing from 0.65% last week to 0.60% by last month.
94.64–100% GDS-higher fares, but the price difference remains modest, dipping from 0.10% to 0.08%.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 98–99% of itineraries are GDS-higher, with a stable 0.51% difference narrowing slightly to 0.47%.
Hovering at 100% GDS-higher with the widest gap, easing from 0.76% to 0.68% over the observed period.
